item.title: Structural Characteristics of Protein Binding Sites for Calcium and Lanthanide Ions
item.description: Notes on a 2001 JBIC review comparing structural features of Ca2+ and lanthanide-binding sites in proteins. Discusses coordination geometries, ligand types, and structural classes of metal-binding motifs, including under-representation of EF-hand in structural databases.

item.title: Diversity of Conformational States and Changes within the EF-hand Protein Superfamily
item.description: Notes on a 1999 Proteins review analyzing the conformational diversity of EF-hand motifs in calcium-binding proteins. Introduces Vector Geometry Mapping (VGM) to dissect helix movements beyond simple interhelical angles, and discusses functional implications of EF-hand plasticity.

item.description: Notes on 2006 JMB review detailing EF-hand protein diversity, mechanisms of Ca2+ binding, and conformational change. Highlights the EFbeta-scaffold model and structural determinants of domain opening in calcium-binding proteins.

item.title: Decoding Ca²⁺ Signals Through Plant Protein Kinases
item.description: Overview of the plant-specific CDPK-SnRK superfamily, including CDPKs, CRKs, CCaMKs, SnRKs, and their Ca²⁺ regulatory mechanisms. Models of activation and functional diversity of Ca²⁺ decoding mechanisms are discussed.

item.title: Allosteric Activation of Toxoplasma CDPK1: A Splint Model for Kinase Regulation
item.description: A fascinating study revealing that TgCDPK1 is stabilized and activated via an allosteric mechanism involving its regulatory CAD domain, challenging classical models of calcium-dependent kinase activation.

item.title: Structural Insights into Apicomplexan CDPK Activation: A Calcium-Triggered Mechanism
item.description: A landmark structural study revealing how apicomplexan CDPKs (TgCDPK1/3, CpCDPK) undergo dramatic conformational changes upon calcium binding to shift from an autoinhibited to an active state.

item.title: Target-Induced Conformational Adaptation of Calmodulin in Complex with Nematode CaMKK Peptide: Insights into Calcium-Dependent Kinase Regulation
item.description: Notes on a 2001 Journal of Molecular Biology paper revealing the crystal structure of Ca2+/CaM bound to a CaMKK-derived peptide, highlighting how calmodulin achieves conformational flexibility to accommodate diverse targets — offering a mechanistic basis for how CaM relieves autoinhibition of kinases like CaMKK and mediates calcium signal transduction.

item.description: Note on the detailed structural study of CDPK activation, focusing on apicomplexan CAD conformations (CpCDPK, PfCDPK3), offering new insight into a potentially universal activation mechanism for CDPKs.

item.title: Prediction of EF-hand-like Calcium Binding Regions in Myosin Light Chain and T4 Lysozyme
item.description: A 1975 Science paper pioneering the computational prediction of EF-hand calcium-binding motifs in unexpected proteins, revealing evolutionary insights into calcium sensor domains and highlighting structural conservation even in non-calcium-binding proteins.

item.title: Discovery of Calcium-Dependent Protein Kinase (CDPK) as a Calmodulin-like Kinase Family
item.description: A 1991 Science paper reporting the discovery of a soybean CDPK as a novel class of calcium-dependent kinases, providing structural and evolutionary insights that shaped the understanding of CDPKs as CaM-like autonomous calcium sensors.

item.title: Evidence for Differing Roles for Each Lobe of the Calmodulin-like Domain in a Calcium-dependent Protein Kinase
item.description: Notes on a 2004 JBC paper exploring differential roles of N- and C-lobes in the CaM-like domain (CaM-LD) of CDPK, uncovering distinct Ca2+ affinities and their role in regulating kinase activation through interactions with the junction domain.
